Highlights from
60420 IFC Annual Report 2008
The world around us is changing, and so is IFC. In a time of uncertainty in world markets, we have stepped up investments and advisory services in the least devel- IFC's Board of Directors reaffirmed oped economies and sectors. Our efforts to respond swiftly to clients' needs are making a difference: we are creating new opportunities for people to break free our five strategic pillars this year: from poverty and improve their lives. k Assisting clients in underserved frontier regions, especially in the We are doing our part for an inclusive and sustainable world. We made in- poorest countries. vestments to expand the supply of high-quality water, one of the keys to expanding k Building enduring partnerships with local companies agriculture and producing more food at a time of escalating prices. We addressed k Ensuring environmental and social sustainability longer-term challenges to economic development, such as climate change, design- k Helping the private sector strengthen infrastructure, from ports and ing business models and financial instruments to deliver cleaner energy and protect roads to schools and hospitals the environment. We pledged $1.75 billion to the three-year funding cycle of the k Strengthening local financial markets International Development Association, the lead World Bank Group agency assist- ing the poorest countries. We also stepped up our support of agribusiness, an industry that touches most of the world's poor people. We are achieving strong development outcomes. IFC clients generated power for nearly 147 million customers in developing countries and distributed water to 18 million consumers in the most recent year for which statistics are available. We IFC's adaptability owes much to the way we measure our performance. strengthened the managerial capabilities of small and midsize firms in many coun- We strive to learn what works and where we need to improve. Our Development tries, training more than 20,000 entrepreneurs--many of them women--through Outcome Tracking System allows us to make mid-course corrections. Our overall our Business Edge program. We helped increase the availability of credit, assisting strategy, moreover, has taken on many recommendations from IFC's Independent in providing nearly 7 million microfinance loans and more than 500,000 housing Evaluation Group, which called on us to adopt tailored country-specific strategies finance loans. and collaborate more intensively across the World Bank Group.
We are uniquely positioned to make a difference for people at the base of the economic pyramid. We are the largest multilateral financial institution invest- In FY08, new investments totaled $16.2 billion, rising 34 ing in private enterprises in emerging market countries. We combine financing that percent from the previous year. We committed $11.4 billion helps our clients grow quickly and sustainably with advice that helps them innovate, raise standards, mitigate risk, and share knowledge across industries and regions. for our own account and mobilized $4.8 billion from other Our affiliation with the World Bank Group gives us additional leverage in terms of sources. Projects in the poorest countries accounted for 45 skills and experience. This unparalleled set of comparative advantages is the main reason our clients choose to work with us. percent of FY08 investments and more than 55 percent of We are playing a central role in implementing World Bank Group strategy. new advisory projects. In Sub-Saharan Africa, investments for In conflict-affected countries, we have helped create jobs by steering foreign invest- IFC's account totaled $1.38 billion; in the Middle East and ment to small local firms. We are developing ways to help sovereign wealth funds make equity investments in Sub-Saharan Africa and in other frontier markets. We North Africa, they climbed to $1.44 billion. are helping raise standards and reform regulations to ensure that development is both environmentally and socially sustainable.
Our success reflects our ability to adapt swiftly to clients' changing needs. Much more remains to be done--but we will do our part, and more. Strong Over the last few years, we have decentralized more of our operations, moving and sustainable economic growth depends, ultimately, on the ability of govern- more key staff to field offices closer to clients. To provide the integrated solutions ments and private enterprises to harness productive capacities throughout society. that clients need, we have significantly stepped up our advisory services business. To It involves creating jobs and entrepreneurship opportunities for women, for people ensure the greatest overall impact, we have increased cooperation with colleagues in rural areas, and for groups on the economic and social margins. It means giving across the World Bank Group and with many other partners. the billion people who still live in extreme poverty a chance at a better life.
Lars H. Thunell, Executive Vice President and CEO
Adapted from the IFC Annual Report, which includes the full text of this message and a letter from World Bank Group President Robert B. Zoellick. IFC AT A GLANCE

doc.repnme: International Finance Corporation (IFC) annual report 2008 : creating opportunity
doc.abstracts: The world around us is changing, and so is International Finance Corporation (IFC). In a time of uncertainty in world markets, IFC have stepped up investments and advisory services in the least developed economies and sectors. IFC's efforts to respond swiftly to clients' needs are making a difference. IFC are creating new opportunities for people to break free from poverty and improve their lives. IFC clients generated power for nearly 147 million customers in developing countries and distributed water to 18 million consumers in the most recent year for which statistics are available. IFC strengthened the managerial capabilities of small and midsize firms in many countries, training more than 20,000 entrepreneurs many of them women through IFC's business edge program. IFC helped increase the availability of credit, assisting in providing nearly 7 million microfinance loans and more than 500,000 housing finance loans. IFC are the largest multilateral financial institution investing in private enterprises in emerging market countries. IFC combine financing that helps IFC's clients grow quickly and sustainably with advice that helps them innovate, raise standards, mitigate risk, and share knowledge across industries and regions. IFC's affiliation with the World Bank Group gives us additional leverage in terms of skills and experience. This unparalleled set of comparative advantages is the main reason clients choose to work with us.
